channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Book authors hail ‘historic settlement’ as Anthropic dodges trial on how it actually acquired millions of copyrighted works to ingest
item.description: A judge ruled in June that Anthropic didn’t break the law by training its chatbot on copyrighted books, but it was still facing trial over how it acqu...

item.title: Katy Perry’s latest real-estate courtroom circus has pregnancy mix-ups, Trudeau gossip, and an 85-year-old foe
item.description: Perry previously battled nuns who tried to unwind their convent sale. Now it's an 85-year-old who claims he wasn't mentally competent to make a deal.

item.title: How A.I Is Propping Up the Economy, and Taylor Swift’s Engagement Era
item.description: Plus, why men aren’t going to the doctor.

item.title: Prosecutors Fail to Secure Indictment Against Man Who Threw Sandwich at Federal Agent
item.description: It was a sharp rebuke to the prosecutors who were assigned to bring charges against those arrested after President Trump’s deployment of National Guar...

item.title: Trump’s secret weapon: Housing chief Bill Pulte morphs into attack dog, wielding America’s property records like a club
item.description: The 37-year-old housing industry scion has also accused Sen. Adam Schiff and New York AG Letitia James of mortgage fraud, and he's attacked Jerome Pow...

item.title: Trump Is Set to Host a Meeting on Gaza. How Close Is an Israel-Hamas Cease-Fire?
item.description: The president’s Middle East envoy signaled that the war would be settled before the end of the year, but seemed to rule out a temporary truce.

item.title: Republicans discover socialism isn’t so bad when they do it, with Trump vowing more deals like Intel to come
item.description: Retiring Sen. Thom Tillis ripped his colleagues for their silence: “You’re going to have to explain to me how this reconciles with true conservatism a...

item.title: Trump Administration Asks Supreme Court to Allow Freeze on Foreign Aid
item.description: The conservative majority has been largely receptive to the administration’s claims of executive power.

item.title: Robinhood CEO Vlad Tenev says investing for a living could replace labor in a post-AI world
item.description: "If you can't rely on labor to generate money to make a living, capital becomes more important," Tenev told Fortune.

item.title: Like Humans, Every Tree Has Its Own Microbiome, a New Study Has Found
item.description: Scientists have found that a single tree can be home to a trillion microbial cells — an invisible ecosystem that is only beginning to be understood.

item.title: Court Records Detail Antisemitic Attack That Australia Says Is Linked to Iran
item.description: Australia has accused Iran of directing an attack on a Jewish restaurant in Sydney through a web of intermediaries. The operation on the ground, court...

item.title: Authorities Respond to Reports of Shooting at Annunciation Church in Minneapolis
item.description: The shooting was reported at Annunciation Catholic Church, which operates a school.

item.title: Paris Will Keep Seine River Open to Swimmers for 2 More Weeks
item.description: The city will extend its experiment with public bathing in the river until mid-September. Swimming there had been banned for a century over health ris...

item.title: Even 2025’s Chaos Couldn’t Keep Brussels From the European August Holiday
item.description: With President Trump’s trade moves, war in Ukraine and wildfires, it was a busy month for the European Union. But not in Brussels.

item.title: Late-Night Killing of a Teenage Girl on a Bicycle Unnerves Amsterdam
item.description: A 17-year-old was stabbed to death as she rode home after a night out. Her killing has shaken a city where cycling safely at any hour is taken for gra...
